greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = product of distinct primes of the form 4k-1 that divide n.
comment: Multiplicative with a(p^e) = p*A011765(p+1), e > 0. - R. J. Mathar, Jun 07 2011
link: Michael De Vlieger, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
maple: A170819 := proc(n) a := 1 ; for p in numtheory[factorset](n) do if p mod 4 = 3 then a := a*p ; end if; end do: a ; end proc:
mathematica: Array[Times @@ Select[FactorInteger[#][[All, 1]], Mod[#, 4] == 3 &] &, 85] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Feb 19 2019 *)
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Dec 23 2009
ext: Extended with PARI program by _M. F. Hasler_, Dec 23 2009
